webinars.title: Webinar Series: Galaxy Resources For..
webinars.description: In this webinar series, we cover resources for different types of Galaxy users and audiences.

tb-webinars.title: Webinar series: Concepts of drug-resistance prediction and mutation-based clustering

sequence-analysis/quality-control.title: Quality Control
sequence-analysis/quality-control.description: In this sesssion, we will walk you through the basics of quality checking your sequencing data. This session consists of a lecture followed by a hands-on tutorial.

sequence-analysis/mapping.title: Mapping
sequence-analysis/mapping.description: In this sesssion, we will walk you through the basics of mapping your sequencing data to a reference genome. This session consists of a lecture followed by a hands-on tutorial.

assembly.title: Genome Assembly
assembly.description: This session provides an introduction to Genome Assembly

variant-analysis/tb-variant-analysis.title: Tuberculosis Variant Analysis
variant-analysis/tb-variant-analysis.description: Variation in the genome of M. tuberculosis (Mtb) is associated with changes in phenotype, for example drug resistance and virulence. It is also useful for outbreak investigation as the single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) in a sample can be used to build a phylogeny.

epigenetics/atac-seq.title: Epigenetics: ATAC-Seq
epigenetics/atac-seq.description: ATAC-seq (Assay for Transposase-Accessible Chromatin using sequencing) is a technique used in molecular biology to assess genome-wide chromatin accessibility. This session will introduce ATAC-Seq and walk you through an analysis step by step.

single-cell/scrna-intro.title: Introduction to Single-Cell RNA-seq Data Analysis
single-cell/scrna-intro.description:
Single-cell RNA-seq analysis is a rapidly evolving field at the forefront
of transcriptomic research, used in high-throughput developmental studies

transcriptomics/mirna-target-finder.title: Whole transcriptome analysis of Arabidopsis thaliana
transcriptomics/mirna-target-finder.description: In plants, miRNAs can silence targets through RNA degradation as well as translational repression pathways, and unlike animals, a large proportion of miRNA and their targets have less than four mismatches. This feature has been exploited for developing miRNAs target prediction tools, providing an efficient approach to elucidate the miRNA-mediated regulatory networks, which can contribute to biotechnological solutions to improve crops productivity.

climate/fates.title: Functionally Assembled Terrestrial Ecosystem Simulator (FATES)
climate/fates.description: This session will provide a brief overview of FATES, and guide you through a Galaxy analysis step by step.

genome-annotation/annotation-with-prokka.title: Genome Annotation with Prokka
genome-annotation/annotation-with-prokka.description: This tutorial will introduce genome annotation process and give you hands-on experience with annotating a prokaryotic genome using Prokka.

genome-annotation/apollo.title: Genome Annotation with Apollo
genome-annotation/apollo.description: This session will introduce the Apollo genome annotation platform, and provide you hands-on experience with using Apollo in Galaxy.

genome-annotation/crispr-screen.title: CRISPR Screen Analysis
genome-annotation/crispr-screen.description: This lecture will introduce the basic concepts involved in CRISPR screen analysis.

proteomics/encyclopedia.title: EncyclopeDIA
proteomics/encyclopedia.description:
Data independent acquisition (DIA) mass spectrometry is a powerful technique that is improving the
reproducibility and throughput of proteomics studies. EncyclopeDIA is library search engine comprised of
several algorithms for DIA data analysis and can search for peptides using either DDA-based spectrum libraries
or DIA-based chromatogram libraries.

proteomics/protegenomics.title: ProteoGenomics
proteomics/protegenomics.description:
Proteogenomics is a field of biological research that utilizes a combination of proteomics, genomics, and
transcriptomics to aid in the discovery and identification of peptides

metagenomics/mothur-miseq-sop-short.title: 16S taxonomic profiling
metagenomics/mothur-miseq-sop-short.description:
To determine the composition of a microbiome sample, sequencing of the 16S rRNA gene
is often used. This allows us to identify the bacterial species present in our sample.
This lecture and practical session introduces you to 16S analysis in Galaxy using the
mothur tool suite.

metagenomics/nanopore.title: Microbiome Analysis using Nanopore Sequencing
metagenomics/nanopore.description:
In this 3-part module, you will learn about Nanopore long-read sequencing for the
detection of antimicrobial resistance (AMR). There is a short video showing you the
wetlab steps involved in using the MinION sequencer. A talk about the clinical applications,
and finally a practical tutorial walking you through an AMR analysis in Galaxy.

statistics/deeplearning.title: Deep Learning Demystified
statistics/deeplearning.description:
This 3-part session will introduce you to the world of deep learning and cover Feedforward
Neural Networks (FNN), Recurrent Neural Networks (FNN), and Convolutional Neural Networks
(CNN).

galaxy-interface/ncbi-sarf.title: SRA Aligned read format in Galaxy
galaxy-interface/ncbi-sarf.description: This session will introduce the SRA Aligned Read format, and show you how to use this in Galaxy to analyze a SARS-CoV-2 dataset.

dev/architecture.title: Galaxy Code Architecture Lecture Series
dev/architecture.description: In this 9-part Lecture series, John Chilton will walk you through the Galaxy Code Architecture.

dev/debugging/tutorial.title: Debugging Galaxy
dev/debugging/tutorial.description: This series of videos will guide (future) Galaxy contributors through the process of debugging Galaxy.

galaxy/r.title: Using R in Galaxy
galaxy/r.description: Want a bit more control over your Analyses? You can run R in Rstudio directly within Galaxy

visualisation/circos.title: Visualisation with Circos
visualisation/circos.description: Circos (Krzywinski et al. 2009) is a software package for visualizing data in a circular layout. This makes Circos ideal for exploring relationships between objects or positions. Circos plots have appeared in thousands of scientific publications. Although originally designed for visualizing genomic data, it can create figures from data in any field.

admin/ansible.title: Ansible
admin/ansible.description: Here you'll learn the basics of Ansible

admin/cvmfs.title: CVMFS
admin/cvmfs.description: Reference data management is easier than ever with CVMFS

admin/pulsar.title: Pulsar
admin/pulsar.description: Remote compute made possible with Pulsar

admin/monitoring.title: Monitoring
admin/monitoring.description: Learn advanced Galaxy monitoring with Telegraf, Influx, and Grafana.

admin/tool-management.title: Tool Management
admin/tool-management.description: Learn how to install and manage tools in Galaxy
